item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Garbage Collected Smart Pointers in Rust via Concurrent Cycle Collection (55 points | 17 comments)
2. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (46 points | 12 comments)
3. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (68 points | 16 comments)
4. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they're made (104 points | 26 comments)
5. Making my first robot as a software engineer (69 points | 8 comments)
6. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (113 points | 13 comments)
7. Donald Bitzer has died (108 points | 13 comments)
8. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (52 points | 13 comments)
9. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (16 points | 10 comments)
10. HyperDX (YC S22) Is Hiring Engineers to Build Open Source Observability ( | hide)
11. Test (196 points | 53 comments)
12. People who are good at reading have different brains (47 points | 25 comments)
13. A Tale of Demonic Possession Predicted the Decline of an Early Medieval Empire (45 points | 30 comments)
14. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (292 points | 73 comments)
15. The pills that cured all ills; James Morison the Hygeist (2014) (18 points | 7 comments)
16. Show HN: I made the slowest, most expensive GPT (36 points | 23 comments)
17. Librebooting the ThinkPad T480 (153 points | 61 comments)
18. Mathematicians uncover a new way to count prime numbers (174 points | 78 comments)
19. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (239 points | 41 comments)
20. Amid cuts to basic research, New Zealand scraps all support for social sciences (209 points | 353 comments)
21. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (1071 points | 161 comments)
22. What every systems programmer should know about concurrency (2020) [pdf] (142 points | 63 comments)
23. Clio: A system for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use (110 points | 38 comments)
24. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (357 points | 178 comments)
25. Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder (670 points | 390 comments)
26. Elixir/Erlang Hot Swapping Code (2016) (205 points | 100 comments)
27. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (1056 points | 433 comments)
28. Implementing network time security (NTP NTS) at the hardware level (2022) (3 points | discuss)
29. Unexpected Keyboard (246 points | 130 comments)
30. A Rare Cross-Section Illustration: Infamous Happenings of Kowloon Walled City (7 points | discuss)
